## The Data

Didn't get to do Week 12 of #TidyTuesday so I figured I'd finally put that Steam data to use (can be found here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2021/2021-03-16)

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(extrafont)
library(showtext)
library(rmarkdown)
library(png)
library(ggdark)
library(ragg)
library(ggimage)
library(magick)
```

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
#load data
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2021-03-16')
games <- tuesdata$games
```

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
#get all games played in April 2020 filtered by average no. of players
lockdown_games <- games %>%
  filter(year == 2020) %>%
  filter(month == "April") %>%
  arrange(desc(avg))

#get top 10 games
top_lockdown_games = lockdown_games[1:10, ]
```


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
df <- data.frame(game = top_lockdown_games$gamename,
                 avg_players = (top_lockdown_games$avg/1000))
```

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
#add custom text
font_add(family = "gamer", "PressStart2P-Regular.ttf")
font_add(family = "montserrat", "Montserrat-Regular.ttf")
showtext.auto()

#create theme
plot_theme <- theme(
  # titles
  plot.title = element_text(family = "marker", size = 50, color = "white", hjust=0.8),
  plot.subtitle = element_text(family = "montserrat", size = 35, color = "white", hjust = 0.8),
  plot.caption = element_text(family = "marker", size = 28, color = "white", hjust = 1),
  
  # panel and plot background
  panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
  panel.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),
  plot.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),
  
  # axis
  axis.title = element_blank(),
  axis.text = element_blank(),
  axis.ticks = element_blank(),
)

games_plot <- ggplot(df, aes(x=game, y=avg_players)) + coord_flip() + geom_point()

```

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
games_plot
```
